thread.title: Budget airline adds flights from Fort Lauderdale to San Antonio
thread.title_full: Budget airline adds flights from Fort Lauderdale to San Antonio

author: Shaun Bevan
title: Budget airline adds flights from Fort Lauderdale to San Antonio
text:
Enlarge Budget airline Allegiant Air will launch nonstop service between San Antonio and Fort Lauderdale on Nov. 5, the company said Tuesday. The new flights will operate twice weekly on Thursdays and Sundays. The new flights is expected to bring over five thousand additional visitors to Fort Lauderdale and generate an estimated $4.2 million in total visitor spending annually. “We are very excited to welcome visitors from San Antonio,” said Kent George , director of aviation at Broward County Aviation Department. “Our partnership with Allegiant continues to expand and now offer travelers convenient service in south central Texas.” Allegiant recently announced plans to add four new flights from FLL. The budget Las Vegas carrier said it will add service to Portsmouth, New Hampshire on Oct. 1, Akron-Canton, Ohio on Oct. 2, Rochester, New York on Oct. 9 and Grand Rapids, Michigan on Dec. 16.
